column4: Suncor running short of diesel in Western Canada
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Oct 2 Suncor Energy Inc   Canada's largest integrated oil company  said on Wednesday that it is running short of diesel fuel in parts of Western Canada.

column4: Oi  Portugal Telecom combine to battle bigger rivals
column5: LISBON/RIO DE JANEIRO Brazil's Grupo Oi SA   facing growing competition from foreign telecom carriers  will combine with Portugal Telecom SGPS SA  to form a new company with more than 100 million subscribers and almost $19 billion in annual revenue.

column4: UPDATE 6-Oi  Portugal Telecom combine to battle bigger rivals
column5: * Oi CEO Bava  a Portugal Telecom veteran  to lead carrier

column4: Telecom Italia may appoint RCS chairman as director - source
column5: MILAN  Oct 2 Italian telecoms company Telecom Italia could appoint Angelo Provasoli  chairman of publisher RCS MediaGroup  as an independent board member on Thursday  a source close to the matter said on Wednesday.

column4: Telecom Italia shares down on strategy uncertainty
column5: MILAN  Oct 2 Shares in Telecom Italia  turned negative as traders said the merger of Portugal Telecom  and Brazil's telecommunications giant Oi  could slow down a possible sale of Brazilian unit Tim Participacoes.

column4: Hutchison seeks EU approval to buy Telefonica's Irish unit
column5: BRUSSELS  Oct 2 Hutchison Whampoa has asked EU competition regulators to approve its proposed takeover of Telefonica's 02 Ireland business  which would make it the second largest mobile telecoms operator in Ireland.

column4: Analysis: Tenet stands out by experimenting with core model of Obamacare
column5: Patients and investors gauging the impact of President Barack Obama's healthcare reform law on hospitals  clinics and other providers need look no further than Tenet Healthcare Corp  the country's No. 3 for-profit hospital chain.

column4: Telecom Italia shares down on strategy uncertainty
column5: MILAN  Oct 2 Shares in Telecom Italia  turned negative as traders said the merger of Portugal Telecom  and Brazil's telecommunications giant Oi  could slow down a possible sale of Brazilian unit Tim Participacoes.

column4: Testing on Keystone southern leg expected in Nov - TransCanada
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Oct 2 TransCanada Corp  expects testing on its Keystone XL crude pipeline to be completed in early November and it will begin filling the line for the first time shortly afterwards  a  spokesman said on Wednesday.

column4: UPDATE 10-Oil rises  Brent/WTI spread narrows on Keystone news
column5: * Coming up: U.S. initial jobless claims at 1230 GMT on Thursday

column4: TransCanada plans end-2013 start for southern leg of Keystone XL
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Oct 2 The southern portion of TransCanada Corp's 700 000 bpd Keystone XL oil pipeline is 95 percent complete and the company is focused on the line starting by the end of 2013  a TransCanada spokesman said on Wednesday.

column4: TransCanada's southern Keystone XL leg to be completed soon -report
column5: Oct 2 The construction of the southern leg of the Keystone XL crude oil pipeline is expected to be completed by the end of October  TransCanada Corp executive Les Cherwenuk said on Wednesday  according to Bloomberg News.

column4: CORRECTED-TransCanada doesn't see Keystone XL presidential permit in 2013
column5: NEW YORK  Oct 2 TransCanada Corp no longer expects a decision on the U.S. presidential permit required for the Keystone XL pipeline by the end of the year  the company said in a Wednesday filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commision.

column4: UPDATE 1-U.S. companies warn of delays  furloughs from shutdown
column5: NEW YORK  Oct 2 The U.S. government shutdown is beginning to hit the factory floor  with major manufacturers like Boeing Co and United Technologies Corp  warning of delays and employee furloughs in the thousands if the budget impasse persists.

column4: CORRECTED-BRIEF-United Technologies may furlough more than 5000 workers if shutdown continues
column5: (Corrects the headline) Oct 2 United Technologies Corp : * Announces government shutdown impact  * Aerospace businesses will be forced to furlough thousands of workers due to the absence of defense contract management agency  * Says furlough number could exceed 5 000 employees if the government shutdown continues into next month.  * Co's sikorsky aircraft will be impacted immediately  with nearly 2 000 sikorsky workers expected to be placed on furlough October 7  * UTC-if shutdown co

column4: UTC to furlough 4 000 workers if U.S. shutdown continues next week
column5: United Technologies Corp  said it would be forced to furlough as many as 4 000 employees  if the U.S. government shutdown continues through next week.

column4: UTC to furlough 4 000 workers if U.S. shutdown continues next week
column5: Oct 2 United Technologies Corp said it would be forced to furlough as many as 4 000 employees  if the U.S. government shutdown continues through next week.

column4: Celebrities tell followers to #GetCovered with Obamacare
column5: NEW YORK While technical problems slowed the launch of new "Obamacare" websites to sell health insurance on Tuesday  the law's supporters on Twitter had an easier time welcoming the "Affordable Care Cat."

column4: Bank of America  Wells Fargo to improve mortgage servicing plans
column5: WASHINGTON Bank of America and Wells Fargo once again agreed to improve their mortgage servicing processes  after state and federal authorities said the banks were still not properly handling requests from struggling borrowers.

column4: UPDATE 1-NY to sue Wells Fargo  strike deal with Bank of America over mortgages-sources
column5: WASHINGTON  Oct 1 The New York Attorney General plans to sue Wells Fargo & Co  on Wednesday over failures to comply with the terms of the $26 billion national mortgage settlement  according to a person familiar with matter.
